items.sentence: Tom doesn\'t need to apologize. He did nothing wrong.
Tom bought a camera at a store not too far from here.
Tom said that he was planning on getting there early.
Tom said that was the first time he tried to do that.
I can\'t help wondering if Tom will get here on time.
Tom asked Mary how many people had come to her party.
Tom asked Mary if she really wanted to do that today.
Tom asked Mary what time she wanted him to come over.
Tom asked if Mary and I wanted to go skiing with him.
Tom asked me to help him put new frets on his guitar.
For lunch we had a pepperoni pizza with tossed salad.
Getting them to give us a discount will be difficult.
How did Tom manage to lose so much weight so quickly?
Tom has two brothers. Neither of them live in Boston.
Tom took off his lab coat and hung it over the chair.
Tom was holding a small flashlight in his right hand.
Most of the passengers weren\'t wearing life jackets.
The rescue party searched for the missing passengers.
The soldiers obeyed their commander without question.
There are still people who believe the earth is flat.
I guess everybody thinks that I\'m in love with Mary.
There were no customers, so we closed the shop early.
They demolished the old temple to build a skyscraper.
I wish I could\'ve eaten at that restaurant with you.
I wish I could\'ve stuck around for a few more hours.
It\'s possible that I might be in Boston next Monday.
It\'s snowed a lot more this winter than last winter.
Tom sometimes says things he doesn\'t really believe.
I\'ll ask Tom to meet you tomorrow at three o\'clock.
Tom wants us to think he\'s richer than he really is.
I think that Tom didn\'t know that Mary spoke French.
Don\'t you think we\'ll find what we\'re looking for?
No matter how rich you are, you can\'t buy true love.
I think it was strange that Tom didn\'t say anything.
I\'d like you to send this package for me right away.
I\'m looking forward to touring bookstores in the US.
I don\'t think it\'s anything we need to worry about.
The vending machine sometimes doesn\'t work properly.
There\'s no way that Tom will ever be able to juggle.
He ran so fast that they couldn\'t catch up with him.
I know Tom doesn\'t like Mary, but I don\'t know why.
I\'ll come to Boston and help you with your research.
I\'ll use the wood I got from Tom to make a bookcase.
I think it would be better to do this some other way.
Tom told me that he would like to visit us in Boston.
I think that it\'s dangerous for children to do that.
Because of the rain, we had to eat our picnic inside.
Children like to pretend to be adults when they play.
If you want Tom to respect you, you must respect Tom.
Tom wanted to know who was going to help him do that.
